Given the presence of a cluster of apples, prioritizing positioning for the cluster seems strategically beneficial for potential future growth and points. Moving UP (5, 3) reduces the Manhattan distance to all four apples in the upper cluster, whereas moving LEFT or RIGHT is less consistent or moves away from the cluster entirely.

The enemy snake is currently far away and does not pose an immediate threat to any of the valid next positions.

Strategy: Continue to prioritize positioning for the cluster of apples in the upper board, while maintaining safety. Moving UP achieves this best from the current position.
